snippet: The charge of judicial activism that has long motivated Republican voters could become useful for Democrats, strategists in both parties suggest.
abstract: Some political strategists suggest that Pres Obama may be able to use the threat of Supreme Court activism, specifically in its Constitutional review of the Affordable Care Act, as an issue to rally his base in the 2012 election; judicial activism has traditionally been used to mobilize conservative voters.
lead_paragraph: The charge of judicial activism that has long motivated Republican voters could become useful for Democrats, strategists in both parties suggest.

headline.seo: This Election, Supreme Court Could Rally Democrats
headline.main: Court’s Potential to Goad Voters Swings to Democrats
headline.print_headline: Court’s Potential to Goad Voters Swings to Democrats
